summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 between an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York and an FBI SSA, coordinating a meeting to discuss an 'Epstein update'. It reveals ongoing inter-agency coordination regarding the Epstein case after his death.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Participant in email chain coordinating an 'Epstein update' meeting; mentions having operations on Tuesday and Thursday.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Initiates and coordinates the scheduling of a team meeting for an 'Epstein update' with law enforcement counterparts.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: Correspondent in the email chain, proposing alternative meeting times due to an early morning operation.

connections.description: Coordinating a meeting to discuss an update on the Epstein case, indicating inter-agency cooperation between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI.

Both are part of the email chain coordinating meeting logistics, suggesting they are part of the same or related law enforcement teams.

events.title: Scheduled Epstein Update Meeting
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for Wednesday at 1:00 PM to discuss an update on the Epstein case between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: Coordination for an 'Epstein update' meeting was actively occurring in early January 2020, after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
The meeting involved high-level officials including an Assistant U.S. Attorney and an FBI Supervisory Special Agent, indicating the case remained a priority.
The FBI SSA mentions an 'op' (operation) in the early morning, suggesting ongoing investigative activity related to the case.
The email chain shows routine inter-agency scheduling between the DOJ/SDNY and the FBI regarding the Epstein matter.
